definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: I have more understanding than the elders, for I obey your precepts.
sentences.chinese: 我比年老的更明白，因我守了你的訓詞。

sentences.english: To such as keep his covenant, and to those that remember his commandments to do them.
sentences.chinese: 就是那些遵守他的約，記念他的訓詞而遵行的人。

sentences.english: How I long for your precepts!
They almost wiped me from the earth, but I have not forsaken your precepts.
sentences.chinese: 他們幾乎把我從世上滅絕，但我沒有離棄你的訓詞。

sentences.english: They had almost consumed me upon earth; but I forsook not thy precepts.
sentences.chinese: 他們幾乎把我從世上滅絕，但我沒有離棄你的訓詞。

sentences.english: Make me to understand the way of thy precepts: so shall I talk of thy wondrous works.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我明白你的訓詞，我就思想你的奇事。

sentences.english: I understand more than the ancients, because I keep thy precepts.
sentences.chinese: 我比年老的更明白，因我守了你的訓詞。

sentences.english: Let me understand the teaching of your precepts; then I will meditate on your wonders.
sentences.chinese: 求你使我明白你的訓詞，我就思想你的奇事。

sentences.english: 8The precepts of the Lord are right, giving joy to the heart.
sentences.chinese: 耶和華的訓詞正直，能快活人心。
